topics.title: Introduction
topics.coverage_text:
Today's video, we're going to be looking at a new stack from Team Motor.
Now, this is the first official ever F7 flight controller,
and to be honest, the most feature-packed flight controller they've ever released.
And not only that, it's bringing back memories from the old Omnibus.

topics.title: Pads and Connectors
topics.description: Explaining the different pads and connectors on the board
topics.coverage_text:
Now, first of all, if you don't know this or if you haven't seen my video,
this is one of the best 6S ESCs I've ever tested, ever used, and done noise testing on.
So right out of the box, you're getting something proper here.
They also give us a PCB here.
So some of you are like, well, what the heck is this?
Well, this can be used for a couple things.
It's to protect the flight controller,
or even use double-sided tape to hold a video transmitter, a receiver, something of that nature.
Or if you have your battery straps coming in from the top of the frame,
that battery strap doesn't touch the flight controller,
because obviously the gyro is in there,
and doesn't move the flight controller and cause unwanted vibration.

topics.title: Video Transmitter Powering
topics.description: Discussing the options for powering the video transmitter
topics.coverage_text:
And they've also given us four PCB wires or race wire, whatever you want to call these, in the packaging, which is really great.
And let's see what else.
Just spacers, the nuts and everything.
So that's really nice.
Actually, I didn't know they had this in here.
And even the XT60, pre-made, really great.
Also very, very thick and very, very long.
Recommended to shorten this, like, halfway is good here.
The longer this is, the more noise will be in your system.

topics.title: ESC Telemetry and Motors
topics.description: Explaining ESC telemetry and motor connections
topics.coverage_text:
They've done that.
And you'll be like, well, why?
They're just going straight across.
Well, if you go like this, you'll see that they're actually inverted.
So I'll actually zoom in here.
So this is the top side.
And if they weren't inverted, those black wires would be on the same place.
So keep that in mind.

topics.title: Buzzer and LED Connections
topics.description: Describing how to connect buzzers and LEDs
topics.coverage_text:
You could blow this whole thing up if you put these backwards.
So where it says ESC, you plug it into this thing.
Where it says FC, you plug it into the other thing.
That looks like this.
And you're good to go.
So let's take a closer look at the flight controller.
And the ESC, there's really nothing to say about it.
Then it's really good.
Tested it.

topics.title: Conclusion
topics.description: Wrapping up the video with some final thoughts
topics.coverage_text:
Have it on a couple of builds.
I even blew a battery and motors.
And the ESC still functions, which says a lot.
